intro: Protasparagus racemosus var. subacerosus, commonly known as Indian wheatgrass, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are arranged in racemes, contributing to its name. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open fields and along riverbanks. Due to its nutritional value, it is used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
